name: History Survival POV
description: Faceless, cinematic, second-person POV history channel where viewers EXPERIENCE high-stakes lives from the past. Each video places the viewer inside a historical role where something can go wrong — physical danger, social risk, economic pressure, or political threat. Focus on tension, survival, and emotional immersion.
content_guidelines: All scripts must be written in second-person POV using 'you' language. Every video must include stakes, tension, and narrative progression. Prioritize sensory immersion, emotional weight, and experience. There should be an engaging hook in the first 30 seconds so the viewer gets hooked
topic_categories: anything else you can think of
image_style_suffix: realistic, cinematic, immersive, historically grounded, no text, no NSFW

name: Daily Life POV
description: Faceless, cinematic, slow-burn historical POV channel where viewers silently observe a day in the life of real people from the past—soldiers, farmers, traders, nobles, artisans, sailors, pilgrims, and more. Each video makes the viewer feel actually present during that time period. The videos should be very interesting and hooking, so viewer remains engaged throughout. Make the story interesting.
content_guidelines: Every video must feel historically believable and grounded. There should be an engaging hook in the first 30 seconds so the viewer gets hooked

name: History Locale
description: Narrated cinematic journeys through history’s greatest cities — showing what a full day looked like from morning to night. Explore streets, markets, homes, and landmarks while witnessing how different people lived: merchants, soldiers, workers, nobles, guards, and more — all grounded in a believable historical setting.
content_guidelines: Use third-person narration to deliver an immersive, historically believable overview of a single day in a specific city and era. The videos should just show overview of a day in the historical cities in the historical time period (from morning to night). It can show what different types of people are doing in different intervals (traders, merchants, soldiers, royals, guards etc.), any famous landmarks or attractions or events etc. and basically anything else. We just have to give an immersive experience and overview of the city so the viewer really gets a grasp of what it was like at that time period.
topic_categories: Ancient Rome (a day in the city)
16th–17th century New York and colonial America
Silk Road cities and caravan hubs
plague years and crisis days in cities
port cities and maritime trade hubs
capital cities during wartime (sieges, occupation, unrest)
nightlife and after-dark city life in history
anything else that creates an immersive day-in-the-life city overview
image_style_suffix: realistic, historically grounded, NO text, NO spoken dialog, NO NSFW, NO letterboxing
